info.title: Person API
info.description: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Keyword search for item

parameters.name: accountableperson
parameters.description: Specifies the Person that is legally accountable for the CreativeWork.

parameters.name: acquiredfrom
parameters.description: The organization or person from which the product was acquired.

parameters.name: actor
parameters.description: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.  Supersedes actors.
parameters.type: movie or episode or movieseries or creativeworkseason or radioseries or tvseries or videogame or videoobject or videogameseries or clip

parameters.name: additionalname
parameters.description: An additional name for a Person, can be used for a middle name.

parameters.name: additionaltype
parameters.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Physical address of the item.

parameters.name: affiliation
parameters.description: An organization that this person is affiliated with. For example, a school/university, a club, or a team.

parameters.name: agent
parameters.description: The direct performer or driver of the action (animate or inanimate). e.g. *John* wrote a book.

parameters.name: alternatename
parameters.description: An alias for the item.

parameters.name: alumni
parameters.description: Alumni of an organization.  inverse property: alumniOf.

parameters.name: alumniof
parameters.description: An organization that the person is an alumni of. Inverse property: alumni.

parameters.name: athlete
parameters.description: A person that acts as performing member of a sports team; a player as opposed to a coach.

parameters.name: attendee
parameters.description: A person or organization attending the event.  Supersedes attendees.

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: The author of this content. Please note that author is special in that HTML 5 provides a special mechanism for indicating authorship via the rel tag. That is equivalent to this and may be used interchangeably.

parameters.name: award
parameters.description: An award won by or for this item. Supersedes awards.

parameters.name: awayteam
parameters.description: The away team in a sports event.

parameters.name: birthdate
parameters.description: Date of birth.

parameters.name: birthplace
parameters.description: The place where the person was born.

parameters.name: borrower
parameters.description: A sub property of participant. The person that borrows the object being lent.

parameters.name: brand
parameters.description: The brand(s) associated with a product or service, or the brand(s) maintained by an organization or business person.

parameters.name: broker
parameters.description: An entity that arranges for an exchange between a buyer and a seller.  In most cases a broker never acquires or releases ownership of a product or service involved in an exchange.  If it is not clear whether an entity is a broker, seller, or buyer, the latter two terms are preferred.  Supersedes bookingAgent.

parameters.name: buyer
parameters.description: A sub property of participant. The participant/person/organization that bought the object.

parameters.name: candidate
parameters.description: A sub property of object. The candidate subject of this action.

parameters.name: character
parameters.description: Fictional person connected with a creative work.

parameters.name: children
parameters.description: A child of the person.

parameters.name: coach
parameters.description: A person that acts in a coaching role for a sports team.

parameters.name: colleague
parameters.description: A colleague of the person. Supersedes colleagues.

parameters.name: competitor
parameters.description: A competitor in a sports event.

parameters.name: composer
parameters.description: The person or organization who wrote the composition.

parameters.name: contactpoint
parameters.description: A contact point for a person or organization. Supersedes contactPoints.

parameters.name: contributor
parameters.description: A secondary contributor to the CreativeWork.

parameters.name: copyrightholder
parameters.description: The party holding the legal copyright to the CreativeWork.

parameters.name: creator
parameters.description: The creator/author of this CreativeWork. This is the same as the Author property for CreativeWork.

parameters.name: creditedto
parameters.description: The group the release is credited to if different than the byArtist. For example, Red and Blue is credited to
, but by Lady Gaga.

parameters.name: customer
parameters.description: Party placing the order or paying the invoice.

parameters.name: deathdate
parameters.description: Date of death.

parameters.name: deathplace
parameters.description: The place where the person died.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A short description of the item.

parameters.name: director
parameters.description: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video games etc. content. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.  Supersedes directors.
parameters.type: movie or episode or movieseries or creativeworkseason or radioseries or tvseries or videogame or videoobject or videogameseries or clip

parameters.name: duns
parameters.description: The Dun & Bradstreet DUNS number for identifying an organization or business person.

parameters.name: editor
parameters.description: Specifies the Person who edited the CreativeWork.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email address.

parameters.name: employee
parameters.description: Someone working for this organization.  Supersedes employees.

parameters.name: endorsee
parameters.description: A sub property of participant. The person/organization being supported.

parameters.name: endorsers
parameters.description: People or organizations that endorse the plan.

parameters.name: familyname
parameters.description: Family name. In the U.S., the last name of an Person. This can be used along with givenName instead of the name property.

parameters.name: faxnumber
parameters.description: The fax number.

parameters.name: followee
parameters.description: A sub property of object. The person or organization being followed.

parameters.name: follows
parameters.description: The most generic uni-directional social relation.

parameters.name: founder
parameters.description: A person who founded this organization.  Supersedes founders.

parameters.name: gender
parameters.description: Gender of the person.

parameters.name: givenname
parameters.description: Given name. In the U.S., the first name of a Person. This can be used along with familyName instead of the name property.

parameters.name: globallocationnumber
parameters.description: The Global Location Number (GLN, sometimes also referred to as International Location Number or ILN) of the respective organization, person, or place. The GLN is a 13-digit number used to identify parties and physical locations.

parameters.name: hasoffercatalog
parameters.description: Indicates an OfferCatalog listing for this Organization, Person, or Service.

parameters.name: haspos
parameters.description: Points-of-Sales operated by the organization or person.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the item.

parameters.name: homelocation
parameters.description: A contact location for a person's residence.

parameters.name: hometeam
parameters.description: The home team in a sports event.

parameters.name: honorificprefix
parameters.description: An honorific prefix preceding a Person's name such as Dr/Mrs/Mr.

parameters.name: honorificsuffix
parameters.description: An honorific suffix preceding a Person's name such as M.D. /PhD/MSCSW.

parameters.name: illustrator
parameters.description: The illustrator of the book.

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

parameters.name: isicv4
parameters.description: The International Standard of Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC), Revision 4 code for a particular organization, business person, or place.

parameters.name: jobtitle
parameters.description: The job title of the person (for example, Financial Manager).

parameters.name: knows
parameters.description: The most generic bi-directional social/work relation.

parameters.name: landlord
parameters.description: A sub property of participant. The owner of the real estate property.

parameters.name: lender
parameters.description: A sub property of participant. The person that lends the object being borrowed.

parameters.name: loser
parameters.description: A sub property of participant. The loser of the action.

parameters.name: lyricist
parameters.description: The person who wrote the words.

parameters.name: mainentityofpage
parameters.description: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described.            See background notes for details.       Inverse property: mainEntity.

parameters.name: makesoffer
parameters.description: A pointer to products or services offered by the organization or person. Inverse property: offeredBy.

parameters.name: member
parameters.description: A member of an Organization or a ProgramMembership. Organizations can be members of organizations; ProgramMembership is typically for individuals.  Supersedes musicGroupMember. inverse property: memberOf.

parameters.name: memberof
parameters.description: An Organization (or ProgramMembership) to which this Person or Organization belongs. Inverse property: member.

parameters.name: musicby
parameters.description: The composer of the soundtrack.
parameters.type: movie or episode or movieseries or radioseries or tvseries or videogame or videoobject or videogameseries or clip

parameters.name: naics
parameters.description: The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for a particular organization or business person.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the item.

parameters.name: nationality
parameters.description: Nationality of the person.

parameters.name: networth
parameters.description: The total financial value of the person as calculated by subtracting assets from liabilities.

parameters.name: offeredby
parameters.description: A pointer to the organization or person making the offer.  inverse property: makesOffer.

parameters.name: opponent
parameters.description: A sub property of participant. The opponent on this action.

parameters.name: organizer
parameters.description: An organizer of an Event.

parameters.name: owns
parameters.description: Products owned by the organization or person.

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: A parent of this person. Supersedes parents.

parameters.name: participant
parameters.description: Other co-agents that participated in the action indirectly. e.g. John wrote a book with *Steve*.

parameters.name: performer
parameters.description: A performer at the event—for example, a presenter, musician, musical group or actor.  Supersedes performers.

parameters.name: performerin
parameters.description: Event that this person is a performer or participant in.

parameters.name: potentialaction
parameters.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

parameters.name: producer
parameters.description: The person or organization who produced the work (e.g. music album, movie, tv/radio series etc.).

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.  Supersedes carrier.
parameters.type: creativework or parceldelivery or reservation or traintrip or flight or invoice or bustrip or service

parameters.name: publisher
parameters.description: The publisher of the creative work.

parameters.name: recipient
parameters.description: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.
parameters.type: tipaction or communicateaction or giveaction or payaction or authorizeaction or returnaction or sendaction or donateaction

parameters.name: relatedto
parameters.description: The most generic familial relation.

parameters.name: reviewedby
parameters.description: People or organizations that have reviewed the content on this web page for accuracy and/or completeness.

parameters.name: sameas
parameters.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.

parameters.name: seeks
parameters.description: A pointer to products or services sought by the organization or person (demand).

parameters.name: seller
parameters.description: An entity which offers (sells / leases / lends / loans) the services / goods.  A seller may also be a provider.  Supersedes vendor.
parameters.type: demand or buyaction or offer or order or flight

parameters.name: sender
parameters.description: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the sending end of the action.

parameters.name: sibling
parameters.description: A sibling of the person. Supersedes siblings.

parameters.name: spouse
parameters.description: The person's spouse.

parameters.name: taxid
parameters.description: The Tax / Fiscal ID of the organization or person, e.g. the TIN in the US or the CIF/NIF in Spain.

parameters.name: telephone
parameters.description: The telephone number.

parameters.name: translator
parameters.description: Organization or person who adapts a creative work to different languages, regional differences and technical requirements of a target market.

parameters.name: undername
parameters.description: The person or organization the reservation or ticket is for.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the item.

parameters.name: vatid
parameters.description: The Value-added Tax ID of the organization or person.

parameters.name: weight
parameters.description: The weight of the product or person.

parameters.name: winner
parameters.description: A sub property of participant. The winner of the action.

parameters.name: worklocation
parameters.description: A contact location for a person's place of work.

parameters.name: worksfor
parameters.description: Organizations that the person works for.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique id for item

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique id for item

parameters.name: accountableperson
parameters.description: Specifies the Person that is legally accountable for the CreativeWork.

parameters.name: acquiredfrom
parameters.description: The organization or person from which the product was acquired.

parameters.name: actor
parameters.description: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.  Supersedes actors.
parameters.type: movie or episode or movieseries or creativeworkseason or radioseries or tvseries or videogame or videoobject or videogameseries or clip

parameters.name: additionalname
parameters.description: An additional name for a Person, can be used for a middle name.

parameters.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. A sub property of object. The person or organization being followed.
The most generic uni-directional social relation.
A person who founded this organization.  Supersedes founders.
Gender of the person.
Given name. In the U.S., the first name of a Person. This can be used along with familyName instead of the name property.

The Global Location Number (GLN, sometimes also referred to as International Location Number or ILN) of the respective organization, person, or place. The GLN is a 13-digit number used to identify parties and physical locations.
Indicates an OfferCatalog listing for this Organization, Person, or Service.
Points-of-Sales operated by the organization or person.
The height of the item.
A contact location for a person's residence.
The home team in a sports event.
An honorific prefix preceding a Person's name such as Dr/Mrs/Mr.
An honorific suffix preceding a Person's name such as M.D. /PhD/MSCSW.
The illustrator of the book.
An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.
The International Standard of Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC), Revision 4 code for a particular organization, business person, or place.
The job title of the person (for example, Financial Manager).
The most generic bi-directional social/work relation.
A sub property of participant. The owner of the real estate property.
A sub property of participant. The person that lends the object being borrowed.
A sub property of participant. The loser of the action.
The person who wrote the words.
Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described.            See background notes for details.       Inverse property: mainEntity.
A pointer to products or services offered by the organization or person. Inverse property: offeredBy.

A member of an Organization or a ProgramMembership. Organizations can be members of organizations; ProgramMembership is typically for individuals.  Supersedes musicGroupMember. inverse property: memberOf.
An Organization (or ProgramMembership) to which this Person or Organization belongs. Inverse property: member.

name.type: movie or episode or movieseries or radioseries or tvseries or videogame or videoobject or videogameseries or clip

description.description: The composer of the soundtrack.
description.type: movie or episode or movieseries or radioseries or tvseries or videogame or videoobject or videogameseries or clip

description.description: The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for a particular organization or business person.
The name of the item.
Nationality of the person.
The total financial value of the person as calculated by subtracting assets from liabilities.
A pointer to the organization or person making the offer.  inverse property: makesOffer.
A sub property of participant. The opponent on this action.
An organizer of an Event.
Products owned by the organization or person.
A parent of this person. Supersedes parents.
Other co-agents that participated in the action indirectly. e.g. John wrote a book with *Steve*.
A performer at the event—for example, a presenter, musician, musical group or actor.  Supersedes performers.
Event that this person is a performer or participant in.
Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.
The person or organization who produced the work (e.g. music album, movie, tv/radio series etc.).

name.type: creativework or parceldelivery or reservation or traintrip or flight or invoice or bustrip or service

description.description: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.  Supersedes carrier.
description.type: creativework or parceldelivery or reservation or traintrip or flight or invoice or bustrip or service

description.description: The publisher of the creative work.

name.type: tipaction or communicateaction or giveaction or payaction or authorizeaction or returnaction or sendaction or donateaction

description.description: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.
description.type: tipaction or communicateaction or giveaction or payaction or authorizeaction or returnaction or sendaction or donateaction

description.description: The most generic familial relation.
People or organizations that have reviewed the content on this web page for accuracy and/or completeness.
URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.
A pointer to products or services sought by the organization or person (demand).

name.type: demand or buyaction or offer or order or flight

description.description: An entity which offers (sells / leases / lends / loans) the services / goods.  A seller may also be a provider.  Supersedes vendor.
description.type: demand or buyaction or offer or order or flight

description.description: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the sending end of the action.
A sibling of the person. Supersedes siblings.
The person's spouse.
The Tax / Fiscal ID of the organization or person, e.g. the TIN in the US or the CIF/NIF in Spain.
The telephone number.
Organization or person who adapts a creative work to different languages, regional differences and technical requirements of a target market.
The person or organization the reservation or ticket is for.
URL of the item.
The Value-added Tax ID of the organization or person.
The weight of the product or person.
A sub property of participant. The winner of the action.
A contact location for a person's place of work.
Organizations that the person works for.
